properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Southwest Pass of the Mississippi River to Port Fourchon Louisiana from 20 to 60 NM; Coastal Waters from Port Fourchon LA to Lower Atchafalaya River LA out 20 nm; Coastal waters from the Southwest Pass of the Mississippi River to Port Fourchon Louisiana out 20 NM; Coastal waters from Port Fourchon Louisiana to Lower Atchafalaya River LA from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 26 at 11:27AM CST by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The areas affected include...
Coastal Waters from Port Fourchon LA to Lower Atchafalaya River LA
out 20 nm...
Coastal waters from Port Fourchon Louisiana to Lower Atchafalaya
River LA from 20 to 60 NM...
Coastal waters from Southwest Pass of the Mississippi River
to Port Fourchon Louisiana from 20 to 60 NM...
Coastal waters from the Southwest Pass of the Mississippi River to
Port Fourchon Louisiana out 20 NM...

At 1122 AM CST, coastal surface and offshore wind observations
reported winds to around 30 knots associated with bands of showers
and gradient winds. These stronger winds were spreading west to east
from near Atchafalaya Bay and offshore out 60 nm to the waters
extending south of Terrebonne Parish and Port Fourchon, and these
stoner winds may spread to the waters near and south of Southwest
Pass early in the afternoon.

Locations impacted include...
Caillou Bay, Terrebonne Bay, Grand Isle, Timbalier Island, Timbalier
Bay, Barataria Bay, Isle Derniers and Louisiana Offshore Oil Port.
properties.instruction:
This showers will likely produce winds to around 30 knots, and could
pose a serious hazard for boaters. A special marine warning may
eventually be required if gale force winds are later expected or
observed. Boaters should consider heading for shore before these
stronger winds arrive.

NWSheadline: SHOWERS WITH STRONG WIND GUSTS MOVING INTO SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA COASTAL WATERS
